content: Determine exactly one command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: a webpage for Columbia Law School, which provides information on admissions, academics, areas of study, faculty and scholarship, careers, community life, and news and events. It does not directly provide information on resources available for legal research.

Links: ['Skip to main site navigation (https://www.law.columbia.edu/#main-menu)', 'Skip to main content (https://www.law.columbia.edu/#main-content)', '\n\n (https://www.law.columbia.edu/)', 'Incoming J.D. Students (https://www.law.columbia.edu/incoming-jd-students)', 'Current Students (https://www.law.columbia.edu/current-students)']
Determine exactly one command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Determine exactly one command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: a guide to free legal research resources in the United States, including federal and state law, treaties, case law, court documents, executive documents, secondary sources, and data sources. The guide emphasizes the importance of combining paid and free resources for effective legal research and provides links to various online sources. It also suggests visiting local law libraries for additional resources and tools such as citators for case validation.

Links: ['Skip to Main Content (https://guides.library.harvard.edu/law/free#s-lg-guide-main)', ' (https://hls.harvard.edu/library)', 'Hours (https://hls.harvard.edu/library/about-the-library/library-hours/)', 'Ask a Librarian (http://asklib.law.harvard.edu/)', 'HLS (http://law.harvard.edu/index.html)']
